definition: Substantial reworking of a draft focusing on content, structure, and clarity - 're-seeing' the text at a global level

positive_examples: Revision involves cutting entire paragraphs, reorganizing structure, or rethinking arguments.
Revision differs from editing: revision addresses meaning and structure, editing addresses sentences.
Experienced writers revise more extensively than novices, who often just edit.
The revision revealed that the third section should come first.
training_hints.disambiguation: Major structural and conceptual reworking, not just surface corrections
